quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

quote: Man is the measure of all things.
author: Protagoras

quote: Life must be understood backward. But it must be lived forward.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
author: Plato

quote: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not.
author: Epicurus

quote: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

quote: We do not see things as they are, we see them as we are.
author: Anaïs Nin

quote: A good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Hell is other people.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: To live is to suffer, to survive is to find some meaning in the suffering.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Time is the most valuable thing a man can spend.
author: Theophrastus

quote: Man suffers only because he takes seriously what the gods made for fun.
author: Alan Watts

quote: Know thyself.
author: Socrates

quote: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Life without liberty is like a body without spirit.
author: Khalil Gibran

quote: The goal of life is living in agreement with nature.
author: Zeno of Citium

quote: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
author: Plutarch

quote: The soul becomes dyed with the color of its thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

quote: It is not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: All men’s miseries derive from not being able to sit quietly in a room alone.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Man is condemned to be free.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
author: Plato

quote: An unfulfilled vocation drains the color from a man's entire existence.
author: Honoré de Balzac

quote: All that we are is the result of what we have thought.
author: Buddha

quote: The purpose of life is not to be happy. It is to be useful, to be honorable, to be compassionate.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Do not fear death so much, but rather the inadequate life.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

quote: Things do not change; we change.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Live your beliefs and you can turn the world around.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The more you know yourself, the more clarity there is.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Man is the only creature who refuses to be what he is.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Freedom is nothing else but a chance to be better.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Life is a journey, not a destination.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Our life is frittered away by detail... simplify, simplify.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: We live in the best of all possible worlds.
author: Gottfried Wilhelm Leibniz

quote: Without music, life would be a mistake.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Life is painting a picture, not doing a sum.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: To the man who only has a hammer, everything he encounters begins to look like a nail.
author: Abraham Maslow

quote: In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Every man takes the limits of his own field of vision for the limits of the world.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Life is short, and truth works far and lives long: let us then speak the truth.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

quote: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The measure of a man is what he does with power.
author: Plato

quote: Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued.
author: Socrates

quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

quote: We are always getting ready to live but never living.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.
author: Socrates

quote: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The secret of happiness, you see, is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less.
author: Socrates

quote: Only a life lived for others is a life worthwhile.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: To live is to think.
author: Cicero

quote: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.
author: Epictetus

quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
author: Buddha

quote: He who is not a good servant will not be a good master.
author: Plato

quote: The function of man is to live, not to exist.
author: Jack London

quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
author: Socrates

quote: Our envy always lasts longer than the happiness of those we envy.
author: Heraclitus

quote: No man’s knowledge can go beyond his experience.
author: John Locke

quote: We are what we think. All that we are arises with our thoughts.
author: Buddha

quote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
author: C.S. Lewis

quote: The world is my country, all mankind are my brethren, and to do good is my religion.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Fortune favors the bold.
author: Virgil

quote: Life without experience and suffering is not life.
author: Socrates

quote: The mind once enlightened cannot again become dark.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Act only according to that maxim whereby you can, at the same time, will that it should become a universal law.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

quote: Do not go gentle into that good night.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
author: Confucius

quote: A room without books is like a body without a soul.
author: Cicero

quote: The object of the superior man is truth.
author: Confucius

quote: An honest man is always a child.
author: Socrates

quote: It is not what we profess but what we practice that gives us integrity.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: What you leave behind is not what is engraved in stone monuments, but what is woven into the lives of others.
author: Pericles
